newsitem.title: UK: UK Labour to seek "right environment for business".
newsitem.headline: UK Labour to seek "right environment for business".

text.p: British opposition Labour Party leader Tony Blair said his party did not intend to be a single-term government and its success would depend on its ability to create the right environment for business.
"We do not want or intend to be a one-term wonder as a government," he told a business conference in London.
"If we fail to provide the right environment for business, we will not succeed as a government."
Outlining the main thrust of labour economic policy, Blair said its primary commitment was to maintaining macro-economic stability.
There would be no return to penal tax rates, he said, and Labour would work with business to improve the infrastructure.
A Labour government would also reduce red tape to help small businesses, improve education and help to open up overseas markets.
Labour is well ahead of the ruling Conservatives in the opinion polls. The next election has to be held by mid-1997.
